reviewText:
Rogue Port - Red Nightmare, while clearly inspired by classics such as EarthBound, does well to hold it's own.
The day/night system, dynamic lighting and randomised loot drops help to give Rogue Port it's own identity.
The battle system is a classic take on the turn based system you'll remember from early Final Fantasy games, with a few more modern inspirations. Approaching the enemy from behind to get the jump on them for example.

The visuals are cutesy and again, hugely EarthBound inspired. The combination of dynamic lighting and a fantastic musical score, does a great job of creating atmosphere, pulling you into the world of Rogue Port.

If you grew up with your mind buried deep inside the huge worlds in games like Final Fantasy, Earth Bound and even Chrono Trigger, then Rogue Port is most certainly for you. If not, you might still be surprised.

It's awesome to see more indie developers working on retro inspired RPGs. The more the merrier, I say.
Go and grab it now.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Rogue Port - Red Nightmare is an adventure RPG game heavily inspired by various
16-bit titles (such as Earthbound and Pok√©mon).

Gameplay:The game plays similar to other games made in RPG Maker: You have your main quest (which is rescuing your friends), various sidequests scattered around the world, monsters roaming everywhere you go, standard stuff. However, there are a lot of little things that make this game different from your normal RPG Maker game, like stamina bar (more stamina means more sprinting time), day and night system with dynamic music, calendar system, pretty dynamic lighting effect, character customization (every piece of apparel that you equip changes your sprite), and so on.

There are quite a lot of different places to visit, like towns, caves, and forests. A lot of those locations don't have anything to do with the main quest, but It's wise to explore them anyway, as they commonly contain hidden treasure chests and key items for sidequests.

Graphics:They are really, really good (for a game made in RPG Maker, duh!). You won't see any sprites ripped directly from RTP packages, like in other RPGM games here on Steam. As previously said, game has a nice dynamic lighting effect, meaning that the light changes depending on location and time. Character and enemies sprites are all nicely made (bonus points for animating them). The only complaint I have about graphics, is that the text is kinda hard to read, I think making the text window a little less transparent would fix the problem.

Controls:RPG Maker standard: Arrow keys to move, Shift for sprint, Esc for opening up the menu, Space for everything else. Those are standard controls in those kinds of games, because they are comfortable to use. If you don't like them for some reason, there's a remapping menu available under the F1 key.

Sound:Sound effects are fitting in most situations, so is music. I liked how it changes depending on time of the day, exploring the forest in the middle of the night is much more chilling because of that. But, no matter how great the music is, it still wouldn't hurt to implement the mute option within the game.

Conclusion:One of the best RPG Maker games I've played. Developer put a lot of work in this small indie title, didn't take any shortcuts by using default sprites and music, and for that sole reason this game is already better than 75% of other RPGM titles, at least in my book.

Do I recommend buying it? It depends. If you like those kind of games (simple turn-based RPG's with retro graphics), then wait for the sale, because as of now, almost 9‚Ç¨ is a little too much for that kind of game. If you played a couple of RPG Maker or 16-bit RPG games before and didn't enjoy them much, then don't buy Rogue Port, because you probably won't enjoy it too. All in all, I personally liked the game and I think that playing it is a good break from mainstream RPG's.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Bad Game, Bad Developer, Just Another Generic RPG Maker Game.

Short~

I'm not even an RPG Fan, I didn't even ask for the game.  I also haven't played Earthbound. This is just another RPG Maker Game on Steam but with a coat of paint covering its stale pre-done engine that jumped on the Underbound train.  Only Undertale was made with Game Maker, has a story worth following and doesn't depend on a stale turn-based combat system.


Long~

The Story!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

The intro/story is poorly explained, right from the start you choose your characters name and class along with the other friends and your dog after that all you get is a few sentences of dialog that explains" the story.  After that you get a very limited selection of choices that will effect your starting stats.......then a meteor crashes in the town and your friends are kidnapped.  From then on its just doing random quest that are just joined together with very little dialogue.

The Gameplay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

You walk around (you can also run as well) on the over world like every other RPG Maker Game
date: the only difference is that the battle changes depending on which direction you face the enemy
recommended: the battles are simple enough during the intro sequence while in the house
hoursPlayed: but don't be surprised if you die right after leaving the house
voteText:
which also leads to a terrible choice the developer made.

At No Point Are You Told That The Phone Saves Your Progress

So after making your characters and going all the way through the intro and making your character....you die and lose your progress. all of it~

And the save button is grayed out in the menu.  I actually had to ask the Dev about this and waited a few days for a response.  By that point I was pretty sick of this game and really couldn't see any difference between this and any other crappy RPG Maker Game that I have seen on Greenlight.

THE GRAPHICS!!!!!!!!!!

Widescreen in 2016 - Nope!!!!!!

Full screen - Yes
helpfulPercent: but its not adjustable ingame with an option screen or anything like that.  You had to use Alt-Enter to adjust it in early versions
votesHelpful:
but now F1 brings a generic RPG Maker text box up with limited setting including start in full screen.

Blury Graphics in Full Screen Mode - But Of Course~  It even makes the text nearly unreadable at times.

The Graphics - Very Mediocre~  Every character looks the same but with different hair and clothes
votesFunny: but have been scaled up and look very pixelated.  The battle background have the same distorted look that Earthbound has and honestly don't look good at all
commentsCount: I'm sure that the code for that effect is either already in the RPG Maker Engine or was just found on a forum/tutorial.\n\nI didn't enjoy my experience with this game nor with dealing with the Developer."

reviewText:
Product received for free

Earthbound inspired adventure with turn-based combat
You are this small boy who need to save whole world and find friends that are missing!

This will also have small puzzles but nothing too hard. Also you must remember to heal up in this game (by buying something to eat or make your own meals) because enemies will hit hard!

Pros
Great soundtrack
Retro visuals
Good level of difficulty
Nice story
Cons
Some text in inventory go front of things (I think that this will be fixed in future)
Walking next to boxes or items that moves is little bit tricky

Conclusion: Entertaining small adventure game with great quests where you must remember always heal up!

reviewText:
Challenging 16 bit adventure game with turn based combat style. Goal is simple, find your missing friends and protect world by fighting various enemies. At start you will choose between three different classes ( farmer, miner or hiker ), and anwer some questions to select your primary character stats. As story goes on, you will progress with levels, skills and different type of equipment.

Lovely music.

PS: Don't forget to save and heal up ( enemies know's to be tough ), and if you want to play at fullscreen press ( alt+enter).

reviewText:
Product received for free

(Beta review: Game was given by the developer for free. This will not affect my review.)

First off, The text was nearly unreadable, it gave me head aches for looking at/reading it.
The graphics are good enough for a RPG, I do like some pixel art.
My biggest complaint:
The game would barely run correctly, moving would lag, moving was stiff, combat was a bit stiff.

Not sure what it qualifies as, a good thing or a bad.
This game is basically Earthbound at the start, everything from waking up in your house from the meteor falling,
The swirly battle patterns, getting your dog to fight with you and even the battle music distortion/wavey background.

I did want this game to be good, I just couldn't play it very much due to blatant copying and just a lack of basic features and polish.

Other issues:
The classes made no sense.
The character creation kind of sucked.
The font is awful, some nastly low res thing I actually have to squint to read (adding to my headache the game gave me)
The map sucks.(The overhead map on the top-left, it's low res, unzoomable and has bad/clashing colors)
The game is laggy even though it's a 2D RPG
The sound effects were lacking



-FINAL RATING-
Stay away for a while and wait till they fix" it.
If they don't don't take it at all
date:
not even for free.

EDIT:
I do not reccomend supporting this developer/team until or unless they can accept creative critisicm."
